notes: Third-generation Pontiac Firebird (1982-1992). F-body platform redesign. Trans Am and GTA performance variants. Timing chain engines. Knight Rider KITT car fame. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Firebird article, January 2025 revision.

Pontiac 2000/Sunbird J-body (1982-1994). Front-wheel drive compact car. Turbo GT performance package. Timing belt engines. Renamed J2000 then back to Sunbird. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac 2000 article, January 2025 revision.

Pontiac 6000 mid-size car (1982-1991). A-body front-wheel drive. STE performance sedan variant. Timing chain engines. Popular family sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac 6000 article, January 2025 revision.

Pontiac Fiero mid-engine sports car (1984-1988). Plastic body panels over space frame. Mid-mounted engine, rear-wheel drive. GT suspension package. Timing chain engines. Fire recall issues early production. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Fiero article, January 2025 revision.

Second-generation Pontiac Grand Am (1985-1991). N-body front-wheel drive compact. Quad 4 DOHC engine available. Timing belt/chain depending on engine. Popular sporty compact. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Grand Am article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth-generation Pontiac Bonneville (1987-1991). H-body front-wheel drive full-size sedan. SSE performance sedan variant. Timing chain V6. Modern aerodynamic design. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Bonneville article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth-generation Pontiac Grand Prix (1988-1996). W-body front-wheel drive mid-size. Turbo performance package available. Timing chain engines. NASCAR association. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Grand Prix article, January 2025 revision.
